intro: Buchnera integrifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved buchnera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Buchnera integrifolia is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal conditions.
